As an AI language model, I can provide you with some information about using mouthwash.

Mouthwash can be used in different ways as per the requirement, including before or after brushing teeth, and can be used separately from brushing. It serves as an additional step in oral hygiene routine to help kill bacteria that may cause bad breath or oral health problems. 

It is okay to use mouthwash every day, but it should not be used as a substitute for brushing and flossing. It is recommended to use mouthwash after brushing and flossing to rinse away any remaining debris in the mouth. Some mouthwashes contain alcohol which can cause dryness of the mouth, so it is advisable to check the ingredients of the mouthwash and consult a dentist to ensure the mouthwash is right for you. Additionally, it is worth noting that some mouthwashes are beneficial in specific cases such as, fluoride and antimicrobial mouthwashes are beneficial for people with a higher risk of tooth decay and gum disease.
